value.title: Real Power BI Project Presentations (Nov 13) 🔴Talk Power BI LIVE (Subscribe & Join)
value.excerpt: Want to see how real consultants work on real Power BI projects? Join us LIVE and watch the project presentations by Power BI Professionals in our Pro+ program.  👉 Want to become a successful Power BI Consultant? Check out our Pro+ Program at https://www.LearnPowerBI.com/pro 👉 For more info on RealPowerBI

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 20: Beyond Report Development - Part 1
value.excerpt: In this video, we describe how to publish reports to the Power BI service, and also cover consuming, delivering, and embedding paginated reports. Finally, we discuss when it's a good choice to create a paginated report instead of a Power BI report.  The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course

value.title: Charticulator Custom Visuals (with Daniel Marsh-Patrick)
value.excerpt: Come hang out as Daniel Marsh-Patrick shows us to use the amazing charticular web browser tool to make custom visuals to use in Power BI reports!  RELATED CONTENT 🔗 Daniel's Website -- https://coacervo.co/ Daniel's Twitter -- https://twitter.com/the_d_mp   LET'S CONNECT! 🧑🏽‍🤝‍🧑🏽 🌟 -- https://twitter.com/HavensBI

value.title: Charticulator Visual IS HERE!!! - Season 1 Episode 1
value.excerpt: We walk through a first look at the new Charticulator visual from Microsoft Power BI team.    Official blog post about the visual: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-the-new-charticulator-visual-public-preview/  Visit the early version of Charticulator: https://charts.powerbi.tips Visual

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Dual Y Axis Chart
value.excerpt: Make a custom visual to have two Y-Axis scales in Power BI.  This chart was made using https://charts.powerbi.tips  Blog Post: https://powerbi.tips/2019/09/dual-y-axis-line-chart/ Visit PowerBI.Tips: https://powerbi.tips/  Source files for this project are located here on GitHub:  https://github.com/MikeCarlo/PowerBI-Dual-y-axis-Line-Chart

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Intro to Tabular Editor
value.excerpt: Tabular Editor is an incredible Tool that enables users to manipulate a Tabular Model at lighting speeds.  Daniel Otykier is the creator of Tabular Editor.  This video will explain the basic functionalities of the program.    Watch the full Series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLn1m_aBmgsbGvz4SsmO_fkeThjDUSWFkf

value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/a4kPkOAYOvg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Aggregation to speed up the performance of a Power BI report even if all IMPORTED
value.excerpt: One of the questions I normally get after presenting about aggregations in Power BI is that, does the aggregation works only for Composite mode and in scenarios to speed up the DirectQuery? or does it work in import mode as well? This video is about this question and shows how you can speed up your model
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/EukzA4vbl2w" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Basics of Time Intelligence in DAX for Power BI; Year to Date, Quarter to Date, Month to Date
value.excerpt: Download the dataset from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/basics-of-time-intelligence-in-dax-for-power-bi-year-to-date-quarter-to-date-month-to-date  Learn more about Power BI default date table or custom date table here: https://radacad.com/power-bi-date-dimension-default-or-custom-is-it-confusing

value.title: Best Practice for Power BI Workspace Roles Setup
value.excerpt: Power BI workspaces are not like old days, that we had Edit access and View access anymore. You have more options for roles in a workspace, and in my courses, I have found that many people choose the incorrect role without knowing what the role does. In this video, I'll explain all the roles in the workspace,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/I7om73MQ3q8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Build Your Own Power BI Audit Log; Usage Metrics Across the Entire Tenant
value.excerpt: Power BI dashboard and reports come with a usage metric, which you can see how users used this content. There is also another usage metrics across the entire tenant, which you can see it if you have access to Power BI Administrator account, under Admin Panel in the Power BI Service. However, what if
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fC6SK2TkoS0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Wr4o5uneFxc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
